title: Accessibility Testing
description: Ensure your app is usable by people with disabilities and meets WCAG compliance standards
common_questions: What's the difference between WCAG Level A, AA, and AAA?
How much can automated tools actually test?
Do I really need to test with a screen reader?
What's the minimum accessibility before launch?
How do I test keyboard navigation?

surface: Conduct 15-minute accessibility audit (keyboard, automated scan, screen reader)
Fix Big 5 issues (alt text, labels, contrast, keyboard access, headings)
Achieve WCAG Level A compliance minimum
Run automated accessibility tests in CI/CD
Understand when manual testing is required
mid-depth: Conduct user testing with people with disabilities
deep-water: Achieve WCAG Level AAA for critical paths
Test specialized accessibility needs (cognitive, motor, visual, auditory)
Train team on accessibility best practices
Prepare for Section 508 or ADA compliance audits

compliance_relevance.ADA: WCAG AA recommended for legal compliance
compliance_relevance.Section508: WCAG AA required for US government
compliance_relevance.EUWebAccessibility: WCAG AA required for public sector EU
compliance_relevance.AODA: WCAG AA required for Ontario, Canada

effort_estimates.surface: 15 minutes for basic audit, 2-4 hours to fix common issues
effort_estimates.mid-depth: 1-2 weeks for comprehensive WCAG AA compliance
effort_estimates.deep-water: 4-8 weeks for WCAG AAA and specialized accessibility
